question.qText: Which of the following best represents the net ionic equation for the reaction of copper metal with lead (II) nitrate?

aBtn.aText:
Cu (s) + Pb(NO3)2 (aq) →
Pb(s) + Cu(NO3)2 (aq)

Cu (<font face="c-Italic">s</font>) + Pb<font face='SuperScript'>2+</font> (<font face="c-Italic">aq</font>) <font face='CambriaMath'>→</font> Pb (<font face="c-Italic">s</font>) + Cu<font face='SuperScript'>2+</font> (<font face="c-Italic">aq</font>)
Cu (<font face="c-Italic">s</font>) + Pb<font face='SuperScript'>2+</font> (<font face="c-Italic">aq</font>) <font face='CambriaMath'>→</font> CuPb (<font face="c-Italic">s</font>)

question.qText: Which of the following was <font face="c-Italic">not</font> observed when zinc reacted with copper (II) sulfate in the video?
Which of the following reactions would <font face="c-Italic">not</font> be classified as a single displacement reaction?

aBtn.aText: H<font face='SubScript'>2</font>SO<font face='SubScript'>4</font> + Ba(OH)<font face='SubScript'>2</font> <font face='CambriaMath'>→</font> H<font face='SubScript'>2</font>O + BaSO<font face='SubScript'>4</font>
H<font face='SubScript'>2</font>SO<font face='SubScript'>4</font> + Ba <font face='CambriaMath'>→</font> H<font face='SubScript'>2</font> + BaSO<font face='SubScript'>4</font>
Cl<font face='SubScript'>2</font> + SrI<font face='SubScript'>2</font> <font face='CambriaMath'>→</font> I<font face='SubScript'>2</font> + SrCl<font face='SubScript'>2</font>

question.qText: Which of the following halogens can replace the bromide in aluminum bromide, AlBr<font face='SubScript'>3</font>?
